Materials.name: Classic rendering
Materials.desc: Virtual material used for the default variables available to an object

Param.name: MatAlbedoIntensity
Param.desc: Material albedo multiplier

Param.name: MatSpecularIntensity
Param.desc: Material specular reflectivity index

Materials.name: PBR + IBL
Materials.desc: Virtual material used for all PBR + IBL based materials

Param.name: MatRoughnessIntensity
Param.desc: Material roughness multiplier

Param.name: AlphaSensitivity
Param.desc: Alpha clip sensitivity, every value below this will cause the pixel to become discarded

Materials.name: Alpha test
Materials.desc: Base material for all materials which require alpha testing

Materials.name: Alpha blend
Materials.desc: Base material for all materials which require alpha testing

Param.name: AlphaBlendFactor
Param.desc: Alpha blending value

Materials.name: Animated UVs
Materials.desc: Base material for all materials with animated UVs.

Materials.name: Tiled
Materials.desc: Base material for tiled UVs

Param.name: HeightScale
Param.desc: Scales the values in the height map to be able to reach outside the range [0..1]

Param.name: MinDistance
Param.desc: The minimal distance at which tessellation should start, tessellation will be applied between this value and MaxDistance

Param.name: MaxDistance
Param.desc: The maximal distance at which tessellation should stop, tessellation will be applied between this value and MinDistance

Param.name: TessellationFactor
Param.desc: Maximum level of tessellation, spawns X more triangles per triangle

Materials.name: Tessellation
Materials.desc: Material which provides tessellation parameters.

Param.name: EmissiveIntensity
Param.desc: Multiplies with the diffuse color in order to adjust its intensity

Materials.name: Emissive
Materials.desc: Material which provides emissive rendering of an object.

Materials.name: Static
Materials.desc: PBR + IBL based dielectric/metal material.

Materials.name: Static + Alpha test
Materials.desc: PBR + IBL based dielectric/metal material, but with added alpha testing.

Materials.name: Static + Alpha blending
Materials.desc: PBR + IBL based dielectric/metal material. With alpha blending.

Materials.name: Static + Emissive
Materials.desc: PBR + IBL based dielectric/metal material. With added emissive mapping.

Param.name: SubsurfaceStrength
Param.desc: The strength of the subsurface approximation, the higher, the blurrier

Param.name: SubsurfaceWidth
Param.desc: The radius for the subsurface approximation

Param.name: SubsurfaceCorrection
Param.desc: Performs corrections to some extent, tune to fit your needs

Materials.name: Organic
Materials.desc: Specialized PBR + IBL based dielectric/metal material, but with an added subsurface scattering pass.

Materials.name: Skinned
Materials.desc: Skinned version PBR + IBL based dielectric/metal material, but with added alpha testing.

Materials.name: Skinned + Alpha test
Materials.desc: Skinned version of the static PBR + IBL based dielectric/metal material, but with added alpha testing.

Materials.name: Skinned + Alpha blending
Materials.desc: Skinned material which uses a mesh with joint indices and joint weights, and is also alpha-blended. Useful for characters. Affected by lights.

Param.name: SubsurfaceStrength
Param.desc: The strength of the subsurface approximation, the higher, the blurrier

Param.name: SubsurfaceWidth
Param.desc: The radius for the subsurface approximation

Param.name: SubsurfaceCorrection
Param.desc: Performs corrections to some extent, tune to fit your needs

Materials.name: Skin
Materials.desc: Skinned material which uses a mesh with joint indices and joint weights. Uses a subsurface scattering approximation to simulate an organic material. Useful for characters. Affected by lights.

Materials.name: Multilayered
Materials.desc: Special material used for meshes with vertex colors. RGB controls the influence of each texture layer in order 1,2,3. Affected by lights.

Materials.name: MultilayeredTessellated
Materials.desc: Special material used for meshes with vertex colors. RGB controls the influence of each texture layer in order 1,2,3. Supports tessellation. Affected by lights.

Param.name: LightMapIntensity
Param.desc: Multiplies with the light map color in order to adjust its intensity

Materials.name: LightMappedLit
Materials.desc: Special material for use with objects with a secondary UV set. Affected by lights.

Param.name: LightMapIntensity
Param.desc: Multiplies with the light map color in order to adjust its intensity

Materials.name: LightMappedUnlit
Materials.desc: Special material for use with objects with a secondary UV set. Is not affected by lights.

Param.name: LightMapIntensity
Param.desc: Multiplies with the light map color in order to adjust its intensity

Materials.name: LightMappedLitVertexColors
Materials.desc: Special material for use with objects with a secondary UV set. Affected by lights.

Param.name: LightMapIntensity
Param.desc: Multiplies with the light map color in order to adjust its intensity

Materials.name: LightMappedUnlitVertexColors
Materials.desc: Special material for use with objects with a secondary UV set. Is not affected by lights.

Param.name: LightMapIntensity
Param.desc: Multiplies with the light map color in order to adjust its intensity

Materials.name: LightMappedLitFoliage
Materials.desc: Special material for use with objects with a secondary UV set and with vertex colors. Uses wind simulation to displace vertices. Uses the vertex color A channel as a wind influence weight. Affected by lights.

Param.name: LightMapIntensity
Param.desc: Multiplies with the light map color in order to adjust its intensity

Param.name: AlphaSensitivity
Param.desc: Alpha clip sensitivity, every value below this will cause the pixel to become discarded

Materials.name: LightMappedUnlitFoliage
Materials.desc: Special material for use with objects with a secondary UV set and vertex colors. Uses wind simulation to displace vertices. Uses the vertex color A channel as a wind influence weight.

Param.name: AlphaSensitivity
Param.desc: Alpha clip sensitivity, every value below this will cause the pixel to become discarded

Param.name: Brightness
Param.desc: Multiplies with the diffuse color in order to adjust its intensity

Materials.name: Unlit
Materials.desc: Static material for standard meshes. Is not affected by lights.

Param.name: AlphaSensitivity
Param.desc: Alpha clip sensitivity, every value below this will cause the pixel to become discarded

Param.name: Brightness
Param.desc: Multiplies with the diffuse color in order to adjust its intensity

Param.name: AlphaBlendFactor
Param.desc: Level of transparency

Materials.name: UnlitAlpha
Materials.desc: Static material for standard meshes but with support for alpha-blending. Is not affected by lights.

Materials.name: Animated
Materials.desc: Animates UV shells, supports tiling, uses PBR and IBL.

Materials.name: Animated + Vertex colors
Materials.desc: Animates UV shells, supports tiling, uses PBR and IBL. Uses vertex colors.

Materials.name: Animated + Alpha blending
Materials.desc: Animates UV shells, supports tiling, uses PBR and IBL. Uses alpha blending

Materials.name: Animated + Alpha + Vertex color
Materials.desc: Static material for standard meshes but with alpha-blending. Can animate the UV shell using the given parameters. Affected by lights.

Materials.name: Animated + Skinned
Materials.desc: Animates UV shells, supports tiling, uses PBR and IBL.

Materials.name: Animated + Vertex colors + Skinned
Materials.desc: Animates UV shells, supports tiling, uses PBR and IBL. Uses vertex colors.

Materials.name: Animated + Alpha blending + Skinned
Materials.desc: Animates UV shells, supports tiling, uses PBR and IBL. Uses alpha blending

Materials.name: Animated + Alpha + Vertex color + Skinned
Materials.desc: Static material for standard meshes but with alpha-blending. Can animate the UV shell using the given parameters. Affected by lights.

Materials.name: Particle
Materials.desc: Base material for particles

Materials.name: ParticleUnlit
Materials.desc: Standard unlit particle material.

Materials.name: ParticleUnlitAdditive
Materials.desc: Unlit particle using an additive blending method.

Materials.name: ParticleUnlitBlendAdd
Materials.desc: Unlit particle using the blend-add method. These particles are easier to see in bright and dark environments.

Materials.name: ParticleUnlitBlendAdd2Layers
Materials.desc: Unlit particle using the blend-add method with two layers. Each layer is blended with the A * B * 2 method.

Materials.name: ParticleUnlitBlendAdd3Layers
Materials.desc: Unlit particle using the blend-add method with three layers. Each layer is blended with the A * B * 2 method.

Materials.name: ParticleUnlitBlendAdd4Layers
Materials.desc: Unlit particle using the blend-add method with four layers, the fourth layer is used as a flat multiplier.

Materials.name: ParticleLit
Materials.desc: Standard lit particle material.

Materials.name: Foliage
Materials.desc: Uses a mesh with vertex colors. Material which uses a wind simulation to displace vertices.

Param.name: AlphaSensitivity
Param.desc: Alpha clip sensitivity, every value below this will cause the pixel to become discarded

Param.name: WaveMap
Param.desc: The wave map describes how the water should be displaced and bump mapped. Should be in the form of an RGB normal map, with the A channel representing the height of the wave.

Param.name: HeightMap
Param.desc: The height map is used to calibrate the waters displacement and transparency along shores. The closer the value is to 0, the weaker the waves the will be.

Param.name: TileSize
Param.desc: The size of each tile of water

Param.name: FogDarkColor
Param.desc: Color of dark fog

Param.name: FogBrightColor
Param.desc: Color of bright fog

Param.name: FogDensity
Param.desc: Density of fog

Param.name: WaveSpeed
Param.desc: Speed of waves

Param.name: WaveScale
Param.desc: Scale of waves

Param.name: WaveMicroScale
Param.desc: Scale of micro facet waves

Param.name: WaterColor
Param.desc: Surface color of water

Param.name: WaterScatterColor
Param.desc: Subsurface scattering color of water

Param.name: WaterSpecular
Param.desc: Specular color of the water

Param.name: WaterColorIntensity
Param.desc: The intensity of water color.

Materials.name: Water
Materials.desc: Standard material which looks like water. Uses the xz-coordinates for the vertices to tile the normal map. Renders foam when the distance is close to a surface based on a threshold. Is not affected by lights.

Param.name: WaveMap
Param.desc: The wave map describes how the water should be displaced and bump mapped. Should be in the form of an RGB normal map, with the A channel representing the height of the wave.

Param.name: HeightMap
Param.desc: The height map is used to calibrate the waters displacement and transparency along shores. The closer the value is to 0, the weaker the waves the will be.

Param.name: TileSize
Param.desc: The size of each tile of water

Param.name: DynamicTessellationFactor
Param.desc: The dynamic max level of tessellation depending on LOD

Param.name: FogDarkColor
Param.desc: Color of dark fog

Param.name: FogBrightColor
Param.desc: Color of bright fog

Param.name: FogDensity
Param.desc: Density of fog

Param.name: WaveSpeed
Param.desc: Speed of waves

Param.name: WaveHeight
Param.desc: Height of waves

Param.name: WaveScale
Param.desc: Scale of waves

Param.name: WaveMicroScale
Param.desc: Scale of micro facet waves

Param.name: WaterColor
Param.desc: Surface color of water

Param.name: WaterScatterColor
Param.desc: Subsurface scattering color of water

Param.name: WaterSpecular
Param.desc: Specular color of the water

Param.name: WaterColorIntensity
Param.desc: The intensity of water color.

Materials.name: WaterTessellated
Materials.desc: Standard material which looks like water. Uses the xz-coordinates for the vertices to tile the normal map. Renders foam when the distance is close to a surface based on a threshold. Supports tessellation (bugged). Is not affected by lights.

Materials.name: Fog
Materials.desc: Requires a standard mesh. Material which approximates distance fog within a piece of geometry (bugged).

Param.name: AlphaSensitivity
Param.desc: Alpha clip sensitivity, every value below this will cause the pixel to become discarded

Materials.name: Grid
Materials.desc: Special material which is used internally for grid rendering.

Param.name: AlphaSensitivity
Param.desc: Alpha clip sensitivity, every value below this will cause the pixel to become discarded

Param.name: Brightness
Param.desc: Multiplies with the diffuse color in order to adjust its intensity

Materials.name: Sprite
Materials.desc: Material which traverses tiles based on time.

Materials.name: Billboard
Materials.desc: Special material which is used internally for billboard rendering.

Materials.name: Skybox
Materials.desc: Special material which is used internally for skybox rendering.

Materials.name: Clouds
Materials.desc: Special material used for cloud rendering.

Materials.name: ReflectionProjector
Materials.desc: Special material which is used internally for rendering reflections and irradiance.

Materials.name: Placeholder
Materials.desc: Placeholder material which gets applied to a mesh if it doesn't yet have a shader

Materials.name: PlaceholderSkinned
Materials.desc: Placeholder material which gets applied to a mesh if it doesn't yet have a shader, but is skinned.
